definitions.definition: To bring (two or more things or activities) together ; to unite .
examples: Combine the milk and the hot water in a large bowl.
I'm combining business and pleasure on this trip.

definitions.definition: To have two or more things or properties that function together.
examples: Joe combines the intelligence of a rock with the honesty of a politician.

definitions.definition: In the game of casino , to play a card which will take two or more cards whose aggregate number of pips equals those of the card played.
To bind ; to hold by a moral tie .

main_definition: ( transitive ) To bring (two or more things or activities) together ; to unite .
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To have two or more things or properties that function together.
( intransitive ) To come together; to unite .
( card games ) In the game of casino , to play a card which will take two or more cards whose aggregate number of pips equals those of the card played.
( obsolete ) To bind ; to hold by a moral tie .
